title: Plans for Australia's high-speed rail network in 1989
description: The federal government has announced the next stage of a long-awaited project to build a high-speed rail connection between Sydney and Newcastle, with services still more than a decade away.  Plans to connect Melbourne, Canberra, Sydney and Brisbane through high-speed rail go back to the 1980s, when a proposal to link the capitals went unrealised. #train #transport #highspeedrail #archive #history

title: Perth grandmother left waiting five days for brain tumour care | 7NEWS
description: A 74-year-old Perth grandmother diagnosed with a brain tumour was forced to wait five days for a bed at Sir Charles Gardiner Hospital's neurological ward, spending time in an open-plan ward at RPH separated only by curtains. Western Australia has the second-lowest hospital bed to population ratio in the country, requiring an additional 700 beds just to meet the national average. The Health Minister has apologised for the patient's experience, while 200 beds at the former St John of God Hospital in Mount Lawley are set to be converted from private to public use on 31 August. title: Western Power loses $1 million in computers | 7NEWS
description: Western Power lost or had stolen 563 computers, laptops and tablets valued at over one million dollars between July 2023 and December 2024, along with 198 mobile phones worth $143,000. The WA government entity's loss rate represents one computer for every five employees, significantly higher than comparable government agencies like WA Health. Opposition members are questioning the Energy Minister about potential sensitive information on the lost devices and the adequacy of security controls. title: Drunk doctor jailed for deadly Dalkeith crash | 7NEWS
description: Dr Rhys Belling, an obstetrician driving nearly four times over the legal alcohol limit, crashed his Jaguar at 130 km/h in a 50 zone through Dalkeith's western suburbs, killing Uber passenger Elizabeth Pearce instantly and severely injuring driver Mohamed Usman. Dashcam footage from Belling's vehicle captured his angry rant directed at his ex-wife minutes before the crash, followed by reckless speeding through residential streets. Belling was sentenced to ten and a half years in jail, with a five-year driving ban upon release. title: Prince Andrew slammed in Parliament | 7NEWS
description: Prince Andrew faced unprecedented criticism in the British House of Commons, with MPs calling him rude, arrogant and entitled while discussing his time as British Trade Envoy. Parliament is pushing for the release of documents related to his appointment and tenure in the role, which is currently under police investigation. MPs shared previously quiet anecdotes about his behaviour, including inappropriate comments to dignitaries and military figures, extravagant travel demands, and failure to distinguish between public and private interests. title: Energy giants pocket billions as bills soar | 7NEWS
description: Australia's three major energy companiesâ€”Origin, Energy Australia, and AGLâ€”generated over $2.2 billion in profits last year while household energy bills have surged dramatically. A Climate Council report reveals that gas prices have skyrocketed since Australia began exporting gas offshore, causing wholesale electricity prices to spike. title: Savannah Guthrie offers $1 million reward for missing mother | 7NEWS
description: Savannah Guthrie has offered a $1 million reward for information about her 84-year-old mother Nancy, who was forcibly taken from her Arizona home 24 days ago. The family acknowledges Nancy, who has a serious heart condition, may no longer be alive but continues to hope for a miracle. FBI footage shows a masked man at Nancy's home, with speculation he may have visited multiple times before the suspected kidnapping. title: Prime Minister evacuated after bomb threat at the Lodge | 7NEWS
description: The Prime Minister's official residence, the Lodge in Canberra, was evacuated following a bomb threat made around 6pm. Anthony Albanese was taken to a secure location while Australian Federal Police conducted a three-hour search of the grounds. No device was found and no one was injured, with the Prime Minister safely returning after the all-clear was given.
